WILL Website Guide

A complete reference to WILL website structure, content creation, and editorial guidelines for authors, project managers, designers

  • Version 2.1

Don't Panic!

Need to know how to do everything with our site? Look no further.

The WILL website is built for clarity. It uses design patterns or predictable blocks of content that appear consistently throughout the site. This makes it easier for users to find what theyâ€™re looking for. It should make your life easier as author, giving you freedom to create content without worrying about putting it in the right place at the right time. You should have creative freedom, and our users should have a great experience. Our promise is a great website for all concerned. This manual provides the details.

For Content Authors

If you create, publish, edit, manage, delete, or adore doing things with any kind of content on the WILL website, this is the place to get started.

For Section Owners

If you manage a program, project, or department that has its own website section, you are the section owner. Here's your owner's manual.

For Web Site Managers

How was this site designed and built? If you are the site manager, what would be really helpful to know beyond the markup? Here's a complete guide.

Designed and built with gratitude and determination by the Illinois Public Media Department of New Media & Innovation.
